page.title: 18Kirknewton Flower Festival
page.content: KIRKNEWTON Church had a Flower Festival in August 1985,to raise money for church funds.There were 31 arrangements which were arranged by the ladies of the parish under the supervision of the Pentland Flower Club. One of the displays was about the Picts who were the first Christian people in the area. Another of the displays was about the Lang Whang which was the Edinburgh to Lanark road. This road had a fierce highwayman called Captain Billie Bailie.He wore a red cloak with a sword by his side.He also had a pack of greyhounds with him. Another arrangement showed the Shale Mining Industry which was started by James Young in 1850. Altogether it was a great success.They raised Â£1850.
